components.name: drag-drop-list
components.helpText:
Reorderable list with drag and drop:

<drag-drop-list
  topic="todos"
  items='[
    {"id": 1, "text": "First item"},
    {"id": 2, "text": "Second item"},
    {"id": 3, "text": "Third item"}
  ]'>
</drag-drop-list>

Publishes {topic}.reorder when items are reordered.

components.name: file-upload
components.helpText:
File upload with drag-drop and preview:

<file-upload
  accept="image/*"
  multiple
  max-size="5242880"
  preview
  drag-drop
  topic="files">
</file-upload>

max-size in bytes (5242880 = 5MB)

Publishes {topic}.upload with file data.

components.name: pan-bus
components.description: PAN Bus - Central message bus for Page Area Network communication

components.name: pan-bus-enhanced
components.description: PAN Bus (Enhanced) - Central message bus with memory management and security

components.name: pan-chart
components.helpText:
Render charts with JSON data:

<pan-chart
  type="bar"
  data='{
    "labels": ["Jan", "Feb", "Mar"],
    "datasets": [{
      "label": "Sales",
      "data": [12, 19, 3]
    }]
  }'
  options='{"responsive": true}'>
</pan-chart>

components.name: pan-computed-state
components.helpText:
Create derived state from other topics:

<pan-computed-state
  sources="todos.list"
  output="todos.stats"
  retain>
  <script>
    (todos) => ({
      total: todos.length,
      completed: todos.filter(t => t.completed).length,
      remaining: todos.filter(t => !t.completed).length
    })
  </script>
</pan-computed-state>

The function receives topic data and returns computed result.

components.name: pan-data-connector
components.description: REST data connector for PAN CRUD operations. Listens to {resource}.list.get, {resource}.item.get, {resource}.item.save, {resource}.item.delete and publishes {resource}.list.state
components.helpText:
Connects REST APIs to PAN topics for CRUD operations:

<pan-data-connector
  resource="users"
  base-url="https://api.example.com"
  key="id">
</pan-data-connector>

<pan-data-table
  resource="users"
  columns="name,email,role">
</pan-data-table>

The connector listens to {resource}.list.get and publishes {resource}.list.state (retained). Works with pan-data-table and pan-form.

attributes.name: base-url
attributes.description: Base URL for the API (e.g., '/api' or 'https://api.example.com')

components.name: pan-data-table
components.helpText:
Subscribes to {resource}.list.state for data:

<pan-data-table
  resource="users"
  columns="name,email,role"
  key="id">
</pan-data-table>

Expected data format:

{
  "data": {
    "items": [
      { "id": 1, "name": "Alice", "email": "alice@example.com", "role": "Admin" },
      { "id": 2, "name": "Bob", "email": "bob@example.com", "role": "User" }
    ]
  }
}

Click rows to publish {resource}.item.select

components.name: pan-form
components.helpText:
CRUD form that subscribes to selection events:

<pan-form
  resource="users"
  fields="name,email,role"
  key="id">
</pan-form>

Listens to {resource}.item.select and requests data via {resource}.item.get.

Submits via {resource}.item.save and deletes via {resource}.item.delete.

components.name: pan-json-form
components.helpText:
Generate forms from JSON schemas:

{
  "fields": [
    {
      "name": "email",
      "type": "email",
      "label": "Email Address",
      "required": true,
      "placeholder": "you@example.com"
    },
    {
      "name": "message",
      "type": "textarea",
      "label": "Message",
      "rows": 5
    }
  ]
}

Supports all HTML5 input types plus custom styling.

components.name: pan-jwt
components.description: PAN JWT Component - JSON Web Token authentication handler

components.name: pan-offline-sync
components.helpText:
Queue operations when offline and sync when reconnected:

<pan-offline-sync
  topics="todos.*"
  endpoints='{
    "todos.create": "/api/todos",
    "todos.update": "/api/todos/:id",
    "todos.delete": "/api/todos/:id"
  }'>
</pan-offline-sync>

Automatically queues mutations when offline and retries on reconnection.

components.name: pan-persistence-strategy
components.helpText:
Route state to different storage backends:

<pan-persistence-strategy auto-hydrate>
  <strategy topics="user.prefs" storage="localStorage"></strategy>
  <strategy topics="session.*" storage="sessionStorage"></strategy>
  <strategy topics="cart.*" storage="indexedDB" ttl="3600000"></strategy>
</pan-persistence-strategy>

Supports: localStorage, sessionStorage, indexedDB, memory

components.name: pan-schema-validator
components.helpText:
Runtime JSON Schema validation:

<pan-schema-validator
  topics="user.profile"
  schema='{
    "type": "object",
    "required": ["email", "name"],
    "properties": {
      "email": {"type": "string", "format": "email"},
      "name": {"type": "string", "minLength": 2},
      "age": {"type": "number", "minimum": 0}
    }
  }'>
</pan-schema-validator>

Publishes {topic}.validation with errors if invalid.

components.name: pan-state-sync
components.helpText:
Synchronize state across browser tabs:

<pan-state-sync
  channel="myapp"
  topics="user.*,cart.*">
</pan-state-sync>

Uses BroadcastChannel API to mirror messages across tabs.

Wildcard patterns supported: * and **

components.name: pan-tabs
components.helpText:
To add tabs, use the tabs attribute with a JSON array:

[
  { "label": "Tab 1", "id": "tab1" },
  { "label": "Tab 2", "id": "tab2", "disabled": true },
  { "label": "Tab 3", "id": "tab3", "icon": "üé®" }
]

Or add content as slotted children:

<pan-tabs>
  <div slot="tab-0" data-label="First">Content 1</div>
  <div slot="tab-1" data-label="Second">Content 2</div>
</pan-tabs>

components.name: pan-undo-redo
components.helpText:
Time-travel debugging for state management:

<pan-undo-redo
  topics="editor.*"
  max-history="50"
  channel="editor-history">
</pan-undo-redo>

Listens to: {channel}.undo, {channel}.redo, {channel}.clear

Maintains history of mutations for undo/redo operations.
